subject: Investing
title: Bear Markets: Anatomy and Recovery
description: A fast breakdown of Bear Markets: Anatomy and Recovery for builders.

hook.text: Since 1929, U.S. stocks have endured 14 bear markets. Every single one eventually ended.

buildup.text: A bear market is a 20%+ drop from a recent high. They last about 14 months on average.

discovery.text: The average recovery to a new high takes about two years, though some took much longer.

twist.text: Most of the market's best days occur within weeks of its worst. Missing both hurts more than you'd think.

climax.text: Staying invested through every bear market since 1929 turned $100 into over $700,000 by today.

punchline.text: Bear markets are the toll you pay on the highway to long-term wealth.
